content:
FabricClient.ClusterManagementClient FabricClient.ClusterManagementClient Class

Definition

Namespace:
System.Fabric
Assembly:
System.Fabric.dll

Represents the cluster management client for performing cluster maintenance operations.

Edit

In this Article

public sealed class ClusterManagementClientPublic NotInheritable Class ClusterManagementClient
Inheritance
ObjectObject
FabricClient.ClusterManagementClientFabricClient.ClusterManagementClient

Inherited Members

System.Object

ToString()ToString()
Equals(Object)Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)Equals(Object, Object)
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()GetHashCode()
GetType()GetType()
MemberwiseClone()MemberwiseClone()

Remarks

The FabricClient.ClusterManagementClient provides APIs which help to manage the cluster as a whole. These are typically administrative commands which relate to major cluster events such as the loss of nodes and the need to recover services in the case of major failures.

Methods

ActivateNodeAsync(String) ActivateNodeAsync(String)

Edit

Activates a Service Fabric cluster node which is currently deactivated.

public Task ActivateNodeAsync(string nodeName)Public Function ActivateNodeAsync(nodeName As String) As Task
Parameters
nodeName
String String

The Node to be Activated.

Returns
Task Task

A Task that represents the asynchronous acknowledgment of the request.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

FabricException FabricException

See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

Remarks

Once activated, the node will again become a viable target for placing new replicas, and any closed replicas remaining on the node will be opened.

When this API completes it implies that the intent to activate has been registered by the system. It does not mean that the activation is complete. The progress of the operation can be determined by using the GetNodeListAsync() API

When this API completes it implies that the intent to activate has been registered by the system. It does not mean that the activation is complete. The progress of the operation can be determined by using the GetNodeListAsync() API

CopyClusterPackage(String, String, String, String, String) CopyClusterPackage(String, String, String, String, String)

Edit

Copies the cluster manifest file and/or Service Fabric MSI file to the image store.

public void CopyClusterPackage(string imageStoreConnectionString, string clusterManifestPath, string clusterManifestPathInImageStore, string codePackagePath, string codePackagePathInImageStore)Public Sub CopyClusterPackage(imageStoreConnectionString As String, clusterManifestPath As String, clusterManifestPathInImageStore As String, codePackagePath As String, codePackagePathInImageStore As String)
Parameters
imageStoreConnectionString
String String

The connection string of the image store as specified in the cluster manifest.

clusterManifestPath
String String

The full path to the cluster manifest file to be copied.

clusterManifestPathInImageStore
String String

The relative path along with the file name of the destination in the image store. This parameter is required when source cluster manifest path is specified.

codePackagePath
String String

The full path to the Service Fabric MSI file to be copied.

codePackagePathInImageStore
String String

The relative path along with the file name of the destination in the image store. This parameter is required when destination code relative path is specified.

Exceptions
UnauthorizedAccessException UnauthorizedAccessException

There was an error accessing a file on the image store.

FileNotFoundException FileNotFoundException

A required file was not found on the image store.

DirectoryNotFoundException DirectoryNotFoundException

A required directory was not found on the image store.

PathTooLongException PathTooLongException

A path to an image store file/directory was too long.

FabricException FabricException

ImageStoreIOException: There was an IO error communicating with the image store.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

Remarks

Both source cluster manifest path and source code path cannot be null.

DeactivateNodeAsync(String, NodeDeactivationIntent) DeactivateNodeAsync(String, NodeDeactivationIntent)

Edit

Deactivates a particular node with the specified NodeDeactivationIntent.

public Task DeactivateNodeAsync(string nodeName, NodeDeactivationIntent deactivationIntent)Public Function DeactivateNodeAsync(nodeName As String, deactivationIntent As NodeDeactivationIntent) As Task
Parameters
nodeName
String String

The name of the node to deactivate.

deactivationIntent
NodeDeactivationIntent NodeDeactivationIntent

The NodeDeactivationIntent for deactivating the node.

Returns
Task Task

A Task that represents the asynchronous acknowledgment of the request.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

FabricException FabricException

See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

Remarks

When this API completes it implies that the intent to deactivate has been registered by the system. It does not mean that the deactivation is complete. The progress of the operation can be determined by using the GetNodeListAsync() API

Once the deactivation is in progress, the deactivation intent can be “increased” but not decreased (for example, a node which is was deactivated with the Pause intent can be deactivated further with Restart, but not the other way around. Nodes may be reactivated via ActivateNodeAsync(String) any time after they are deactivated. If the deactivation is not complete this will cancel the deactivation. A node which goes down and comes back up while deactivated will still need to be reactivated before services will be placed on that node.

Service Fabric ensures that deactivation is a 'safe' process. It performs several safety checks (see SafetyCheckKind) to ensure that there is no loss of availability or data

Remarks

When this API completes it implies that the intent to deactivate has been registered by the system. It does not mean that the deactivation is complete. The progress of the operation can be determined by using the GetNodeListAsync() API

Once the deactivation is in progress, the deactivation intent can be “increased” but not decreased (for example, a node which is was deactivated with the Pause intent can be deactivated further with Restart, but not the other way around. Nodes may be reactivated via ActivateNodeAsync(String) any time after they are deactivated. If the deactivation is not complete this will cancel the deactivation. A node which goes down and comes back up while deactivated will still need to be reactivated before services will be placed on that node.

Service Fabric ensures that deactivation is a 'safe' process. It performs several safety checks (see SafetyCheckKind) to ensure that there is no loss of availability or data

ProvisionFabricAsync(String, String) ProvisionFabricAsync(String, String)

Edit

Provisions the Service Fabric.

public Task ProvisionFabricAsync(string patchFilePath, string clusterManifestFilePath)Public Function ProvisionFabricAsync(patchFilePath As String, clusterManifestFilePath As String) As Task
Parameters
patchFilePath
String String

The path to the update patch file.

clusterManifestFilePath
String String

The path to the cluster manifest.

Returns
Task Task

The provisioned Service Fabric.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

The FabricClient object is in a closed state. Dispose of the FabricClient object you are using and instantiate a new FabricClient object.

Remarks

A null value is permitted for either the patchFilePath parameter or the clusterManifestFilePath parameter. A null value cannot be used for both parameters.

This will upload the patch file and/or cluster manifest file to the image store location. The image store location is specified as a configuration setting in the cluster manifest that was provided when the cluster was created.

Cluster manifest validation will occur within the context of this call.

A null value is permitted for either the patchFilePath parameter or the clusterManifestFilePath parameter. A null value cannot be used for both parameters.

This will upload the patch file and/or cluster manifest file to the image store location. The image store location is specified as a configuration setting in the cluster manifest that was provided when the cluster was created.

Cluster manifest validation will occur within the context of this call.

RecoverPartitionAsync(Guid) RecoverPartitionAsync(Guid)

Edit

Indicates to the Service Fabric cluster that it should attempt to recover a specific partition which is currently stuck in quorum loss.

public Task RecoverPartitionAsync(Guid partitionId)Public Function RecoverPartitionAsync(partitionId As Guid) As Task
Parameters
partitionId
Guid Guid

The partition id to recover

Returns
Task Task

A task representing acknowledgement of the intent.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

FabricException FabricException

See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

Remarks

This operation should only be performed if it is known that the replicas that are down cannot be recovered. Incorrect use of this API can cause potential data loss.

RemoveClusterPackage(String, String, String) RemoveClusterPackage(String, String, String)

Edit

Deletes the ClusterManifest file and/or Service Fabric MSI file from the ImageStore.

public void RemoveClusterPackage(string imageStoreConnectionString, string clusterManifestPathInImageStore, string codePackagePathInImageStore)Public Sub RemoveClusterPackage(imageStoreConnectionString As String, clusterManifestPathInImageStore As String, codePackagePathInImageStore As String)
Parameters
imageStoreConnectionString
String String

The connection string for the ImageStore as specified in the Cluster Manifest.

clusterManifestPathInImageStore
String String

The relative path of ClusterManifest file in the ImageStore.

codePackagePathInImageStore
String String

The relative path of Service Fabric MSI file in the ImageStore.

Exceptions
UnauthorizedAccessException UnauthorizedAccessException

There was an error accessing a file on the ImageStore.

FabricException FabricException

ImageStoreIOException: There was an IO error communicating with the ImageStore.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

Remarks

Either clusterManifestRelativePath or codeRelativePath parameter can be null. However, both of them cannot be null.

RemoveNodeStateAsync(String) RemoveNodeStateAsync(String)

Edit

Indicates that the persisted data of a node is lost (e.g., due to disk failure, or reimage, etc.), and that Service Fabric should treat any services or state on that node as lost and unrecoverable.

public Task RemoveNodeStateAsync(string nodeName)Public Function RemoveNodeStateAsync(nodeName As String) As Task
Parameters
nodeName
String String

The name of the node which has been permanently lost.

Returns
Task Task

A task representing the operation.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

FabricException FabricException

See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

Remarks

After a node goes down, Service Fabric will keep track of replicas of persisted services on that node as they have state on that node.

In cases where the administrator knows that the persisted state on a node has been permanently lost the RemoveNodeStateAsync(String) method should be called ... to notify Service Fabric that the state on the node is gone (or the node can never come back with the state it had).

This instructs Service Fabric to stop waiting for that node (and any persisted replicas on that node) to recover.

NOTE: This API must be called only after it has been determined that the state on that node has been lost.

If this API is called and then the node comes back with its state intact it is Undefined Behavior

RemoveNodeStateAsync(String, TimeSpan, CancellationToken) RemoveNodeStateAsync(String, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)

Edit

Indicates that a particular node (which is down) has actually been lost, and that Service Fabric should treat any services or state on that node as lost and unrecoverable.

public Task RemoveNodeStateAsync(string nodeName, TimeSpan timeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Public Function RemoveNodeStateAsync(nodeName As String, timeout As TimeSpan, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task
Parameters
nodeName
String String

The name of the node which has been permanently lost.

timeout
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The timespan that defines the maximum amount of time will allow this operation to continue before returning a TimeoutException.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The optional cancellation token that the operation is observing. It can be used to send a notification that the operation should be canceled. Note that cancellation is advisory and that the operation may still be completed even if it is cancelled.

Returns
Task Task

A task representing the operation.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

TimeoutException TimeoutException

See for handling common FabricClient failures.

FabricException FabricException

See also for handling common FabricClient failures.

Remarks

After a node goes down, Service Fabric will keep track of replicas of persisted services on that node as they have state on that node.

In cases where the administrator knows that a node (and its state) has been permanently lost the RemoveNodeStateAsync(String) method should be called.

This instructs Service Fabric to stop waiting for that node (and any persisted replicas on that node) to recover.

NOTE: This API must be called only after it has been determined that the state on that node has been lost.

If this API is called and then the node comes back with its state intact it is Undefined Behavior

ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(Boolean) ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(Boolean)

Edit

Toggles whether the Cluster Resource Balancer will report a health warning when it's unable to place a replica. 

public Task ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(bool enabled)Public Function ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(enabled As Boolean) As Task
Parameters
enabled
Boolean Boolean

A boolean value, which if true causes reporting when a replica is unabled to be placed.

Returns
Task Task

The task associated with this async method.

Remarks

If this method is called twice with the value false, it clears from memory the reports that would potentially have been emitted. If this method is called with the value true, the Cluster Resource Balancer will report a health warning when it's unable to place a replica. If such health warnings are blocking a monitored upgrade's health checks the toggle can be switched off.

ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(Boolean, TimeSpan, CancellationToken) ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(Boolean, TimeSpan, CancellationToken)

Edit

Toggles whether the Cluster Resource Balancer will report a health warning when it's unable to place a replica. 

public Task ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(bool enabled, TimeSpan timeout, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Public Function ToggleVerboseServicePlacementHealthReportingAsync(enabled As Boolean, timeout As TimeSpan, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task
Parameters
enabled
Boolean Boolean

A boolean value, which if true causes reporting when a replica is unabled to be placed.

timeout
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The length of time within which the async method must complete in order for the method to not time out.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

A cancellation token for this method.

Returns
Task Task

The task associated with this async method.

Remarks

If this method is called twice with the value false, it clears from memory the reports that would potentially have been emitted. If this method is called with the value true, the Cluster Resource Balancer will report a health warning when it's unable to place a replica. If such health warnings are blocking a monitored upgrade's health checks, the toggle can be switched off.

UnprovisionFabricAsync(String, String) UnprovisionFabricAsync(String, String)

Edit

Unprovisions the Service Fabric.

public Task UnprovisionFabricAsync(string codeVersion, string configVersion)Public Function UnprovisionFabricAsync(codeVersion As String, configVersion As String) As Task
Parameters
codeVersion
String String

The code version to unprovision.

configVersion
String String

The configuration version to unprovision.

Returns
Task Task

The unprovisioned Service Fabric.

Exceptions
FabricObjectClosedException FabricObjectClosedException

The FabricClient object is in a closed state. Dispose of the FabricClient object you are using and instantiate a new FabricClient object.

Remarks

A null value is permitted for either the codeVersion parameter or the configVersion parameter. A null value cannot be used for both parameters.

This will delete the patch file and/or cluster manifest file from the image store location. The image store location is specified as a configuration setting in the cluster manifest that was provided when the cluster was created.
